Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Komast pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (very worn) below; exterior; band of short diagonals between pairs of dilute lines at rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting possibly of komast's shoulder with pendant half rosette with added red centre as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group B of the Black Figure Komast chalices. On these chalices a rim pattern is always present and on some of them, short and wide pendant rosettes hang from it. Some sherds in this group, including this one, are loosely connected with Group D of the Sphinx and Lion Style on the basis of the type of rosette.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 170, p. 326, no. 1502)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1256) (phase 2)
